ISSUE.TITLE: Python library documentation shows calls but not responses for all sections besides database
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: # Improve documentation ## Link [https://supabase.com/docs/reference/python/auth-signup](url) ## Describe the problem In the auth section, we are given a code sample like so: `res = supabase.auth.sign_up({ "email": 'example@email.com', "password": 'example-password', })` But in the database section, we are given the code sample for a call: `response = supabase.table('countries').select("*").execute()` and also the response: `APIResponse(data=[{'id': 1, 'name': 'Afghanistan'}, {'id': 2, 'name': 'Albania'}, {'id': 3, 'name': 'Algeria'}], count=None)` Instead of anything like this, the total information we are given for understanding the response to this call for signing up a user is this: > - Confirm email determines if users need to confirm their email address after signing up. > - If Confirm email is enabled, a user is returned but session is null. > - If Confirm email is disabled, both a user and a session are returned. ## Describe the improvement Sample responses to all of the methods shown in the documentation should be given ## Additional context ![Screenshot 2024-03-17 011034](https://github.com/supabase/supabase/assets/128648365/60ce1da6-b6a7-49e4-be49-c5ae6cd89644)

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: feat: Allow for configuring target envs for Vercel integration (#25782)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fixed Python code and updated docs with responses (Issue: #22070)

Fix Python code and update docs with responses (#25852) * Fixed Python code and updated docs with responses (Issue: #22070) * Made the code readable * Update apps/docs/spec/supabase_py_v2.yml --------- Co-authored-by: Charis <26616127+charislam@users.noreply.github.com>
